description: BCI stability reaches critical levels. Lenart Kova quietly intervenes: triggers a complete BCI shutdown protocol, leaving a brief encrypted message for key technicians outlining basics for local coordination.
Council issues urgent statement: "BCI scoring and controls suspended citywide for two weeks to allow system reset." Residents are suddenly free of algorithmic restrictions.

Uncertainty grips the city as residents navigate life without BCI scores. Spontaneous neighborhood assemblies and mutual aid groups form to address disputes and distribute resources. Chaos gradually gives way to locally organized calm.

Street-level 'trust tokens'—badges of local reputation—replace digital scores as informal systems of access and fairness take hold. Formerly marginalized citizens step up as leaders in improvised communities.
After two weeks of BCI absence, division is clear: some demand full restoration, while others call for reform or an end to the system, setting the stage for a decisive civic debate.
